A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Like most\, very excited to see The Last Jedi. Like some\, I really enjoyed the last installment\, The Force Awakens. However\, after the credits rolled I knew something was off\, wrong - contradictory to the last film in an almost deliberate ways. I am not sure why Rian Johnson would be allowed to write an installment that focuses on negating the last film in such a focused method\, with certain overtones of empowerment and political opinion sort of bleeding through the film in spite of the story line. I enjoyed the experience of watching a new chapter of Star Wars on the big screen\, the spectacle of it all is the pinnacle of special effects and quality on a technical side. However\, this film is a very frustrating one\, my hope is JJ Abrams can repair the damage done to the overall story arch damage created in The Last Jedi.
